section.p: The weight of the air above becomes almost palpable as you descend deep into the ground. A trickle of sweat runs down your spine. Each breath you take tastes hot and stale.

Turning a bend in the passage, you see a sight to harrow your soul. Wreathed in silver light, a group of frightful-visaged spectres are turning slowly in the air, dancing a slow minuet to the mournful tune of an invisible harpsichord.

choices.choice: Use a spectral veil (if you have one)
